TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit SelectionGlyph extends System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph
Public MustInherit Class SelectionGlyph Inherits DesignerGlyph

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Provides methods and properties for all glyph classes that an displays when it is selected on the workflow design surface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
Some glyphs that are displayed on an activity designer can be selected by the user while others cannot. When a user selects a glyph that can be selected, the glyph changes appearance on the activity design surface. The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SelectionGlyph> class is the base class for all glyph classes that change appearance when a user selects it on the activity design surface.

block.para: When you inherit from , you must override the following member: .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Unless overridden in a derived class, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SelectionGlyph.GetBounds%2A> returns a rectangle one-and-one-half times the size of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.Bounds%2A> of `designer`.

Docs.param: The with which the selection glyph is associated.
Docs.summary: Returns an array of rectangles that represents the selected glyph's grab handles.
Docs.returns: A array of the grab handles to display on the selected glyph.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Grab handles are the small boxes on the edge of a selected glyph that a user can grab and move to drag or resize the glyph.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SelectionGlyph.OnPaint%2A> draws all elements of the glyph that the user selects, including the glyphs grab handles.

Docs.summary: Gets the view priority of the glyph on the activity designer.
Docs.value: An integer that represents the view priority of the glyph on the activity designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The possible priority settings are defined by the following <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph> fields:
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph.HighestPriority>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph.LowestPriority>, and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph.NormalPriority>.
